<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
if(it.next().getValue(String.class).equals(startDate)){
    while(it.hasNext()){
        if(it.next().getValue(String.class).equals(endDate)){
            names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next() method to get the next value in the iterator, and then check if it matches the start or end date. If it does, you can use a while loop to iterate through the rest of the values in the iterator and add them to the list.
